definitions: To make something square or rectangular in shape.
To make things consistent or in agreement.
To pay a debt or settle an account.
To adjust oneself to a situation or person.
To multiply a number by itself.
examples: The carpenter will square the edges of the wood.
We need to square our accounts before the end of the month.
He tried to square his actions with his conscience.
Can you square the numbers for me?
They had to square themselves with the new rules.
